alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 115 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cimarron, or 26 miles northwest of Springer, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cimarron and Philmont Scout Ranch. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 300 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
